solution_line_template: Since the population of Mojave has increased three times the number it was a decade ago, there are {increase_factor}*{initial_population} = <<{increase_factor}*{initial_population}={current_population}>>{current_population} people in Mojave now.

It's predicted that the population will increase by {predicted_increase_percentage}*{current_population} = <<{predicted_increase_percentage}*{current_population}={predicted_increase_amount}>>{predicted_increase_amount} people after five years.

This means there will be {current_population}+{predicted_increase_amount} = <<{current_population}+{predicted_increase_amount}={population_in_five_years}>>{population_in_five_years} people living in Mojave in five years.
